etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in William Saville-Kent (1845–1908), marine biologist. From scientific Latin Opalinidae, family name from Opalina, genus name + -idae

definitions: A protozoan of the group Opalinata, which comprises ciliated organisms parasitic in the intestines of lower vertebrates, especially frogs and toads.

notes.text: Formerly regarded as ciliates, the Opalinata have recently been treated variously as a phylum, as a subphylum of the Sarcomastigophora, and as a class of the Zoomastigophora.

definitions: Of or relating to the opalinids.
